segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Databases

segment.source: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database by using:
segment.target: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database by using:

segment.source: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: The instructions are based on the recommended architecture in High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: Before you start the configuration:
segment.target: Before you start the configuration:

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Where to get instructions
segment.target: Where to get instructions

segment.source: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.

segment.source: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.
segment.target: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you plan to configure an MBAM Server feature.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you plan to configure an MBAM Server feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can install the databases to a remote SQL Server computer by using Windows PowerShell or an exported data-tier application (DAC) package.
segment.target: You can install the databases to a remote SQL Server computer by using Windows PowerShell or an exported data-tier application (DAC) package.

segment.source: For more information about DAC packages, see Data-tier Applications.
segment.target: For more information about DAC packages, see Data-tier Applications.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.
segment.target: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: To configure the databases by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To configure the databases by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Use the Enable-MbamDatabase Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the databases.
segment.target: Use the Enable-MbamDatabase Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the databases.

segment.source: To get information about this Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamDatabase.
segment.target: To get information about this Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamDatabase.

segment.source: To configure the Compliance and Audit Database by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the Compliance and Audit Database by using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to configure the databases, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to configure the databases, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.
segment.target: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.

segment.source: Click Add New Features, select Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click Add New Features, select Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database, and then click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the databases have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the databases have been met.

segment.source: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.
segment.target: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:
segment.target: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server name
segment.target: SQL Server name

segment.source: Name of the server where you are configuring the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Name of the server where you are configuring the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.
segment.target: You must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.

segment.source: The default port number is 1433.
segment.target: The default port number is 1433.

segment.source: SQL Server database instance
segment.target: SQL Server database instance

segment.source: Name of the database instance where the compliance and audit data will be stored.
segment.target: Name of the database instance where the compliance and audit data will be stored.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database information will be located.

segment.source: Database name
segment.target: Database name

segment.source: Name of the database that will store the compliance data.
segment.target: Name of the database that will store the compliance data.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name that was used in your previous deployment.
segment.target: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name that was used in your previous deployment.

segment.source: Read/write access domain user or group
segment.target: Read/write access domain user or group

segment.source: Domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in this database.
segment.target: Domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in this database.

segment.source: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.
segment.target: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.

segment.source: If you enter a group in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a group in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.

segment.source: Read-only access domain user or group
segment.target: Read-only access domain user or group

segment.source: Name of the user or group that will have read-only permission to this database to enable the reports to access the compliance data in this database.
segment.target: Name of the user or group that will have read-only permission to this database to enable the reports to access the compliance data in this database.

segment.source: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same user as the one you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page.
segment.target: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same user as the one you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page.

segment.source: If you enter a group in this field, the value that you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page must be a member of the group that you specify in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a group in this field, the value that you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page must be a member of the group that you specify in this field.

segment.source: Continue to the next section to configure the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Continue to the next section to configure the Recovery Database.

segment.source: To configure the Recovery Database by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the Recovery Database by using the wizard

segment.source: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:
segment.target: Using the following descriptions, enter the field values in the wizard:

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server name
segment.target: SQL Server name

segment.source: Name of the server where you are configuring the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Name of the server where you are configuring the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must add an exception on the Recovery Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.
segment.target: You must add an exception on the Recovery Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.

segment.source: The default port number is 1433.
segment.target: The default port number is 1433.

segment.source: SQL Server database instance
segment.target: SQL Server database instance

segment.source: Name of the database instance where the recovery data will be stored.
segment.target: Name of the database instance where the recovery data will be stored.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database information will be located.

segment.source: Database name
segment.target: Database name

segment.source: Name of the database that will store the recovery data.
segment.target: Name of the database that will store the recovery data.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name that was used in your previous deployment.
segment.target: If you are upgrading from a previous version of MBAM, you must use the same database name as the name that was used in your previous deployment.

segment.source: Read/write access domain user or group
segment.target: Read/write access domain user or group

segment.source: Domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in this database.
segment.target: Domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in this database.

segment.source: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.
segment.target: If you enter a user in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.

segment.source: If you enter a group in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a group in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.

segment.source: When you finish your entries, click Next.
segment.target: When you finish your entries, click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the databases have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the databases have been met.

segment.source: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.
segment.target: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Next again.
segment.target: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Next again.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries that you just made, click Export PowerShell Script, and then save the script.
segment.target: To create a Windows PowerShell script of the entries that you just made, click Export PowerShell Script, and then save the script.

segment.source: Click Add to add the MBAM databases on the server, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Add to add the MBAM databases on the server, and then click Close.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got a MBAM issue?
segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
